Khoury, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of KLX Energy Services commented, "Contemporaneously with the abrupt decline in activity, we took steps to align our business with current customer demand. Specifically, we implemented an approximate 17 percent reduction in force, as compared with the Company's July 31, 2019 staffing levels, consistent with the approximate 18 percent sequential quarterly decline in our third quarter revenues. We aggressively cut costs in every area of our business, and we warm stacked the vast majority of our Permian based wireline assets. As a result of these and other measures, we expect to take a third quarter charge of approximately $13 million. Notwithstanding the precipitous decline in industry conditions, we generated approximately $44 million in cash flow from operations and approximately $31 million in free cash flow, bringing our cash balance to approximately $121 million for the quarter ended October 31, 2019. In addition, our $100 million credit facility remains undrawn.""The abrupt deterioration in industry conditions, which accelerated through the end of our third quarter, was driven by a sharp sequential quarterly decline in U.S. land rig count and an unprecedented decline in active frac spreads from the second quarter to the third quarter. In fact, there was a significant sequential decline in hydraulic fracturing activity during each month of the third quarter. The decline in Exploration & Production activity resulted in lower demand levels and lower current and expected revenues for our business, which led the Company to accelerate its annual testing for asset impairment into the third quarter. While the Company has not yet completed this analysis, we expect to report a non-cash asset impairment charge in the range of approximately $45 million to $60 million. The Company is in the process of finalizing the actual amount of the impairment charge, which will be completed prior to reporting its third quarter financial results."06:00CEO CNOOC Ltd names President Xu Keqiang as CEO (152.50 )06:00TRP TC Energy to provide financial update and review strategic plans at Investor Day, reaffirms expectation to grow common share dividend at an annual rate of 8-10% through 2021 (51.44 )"Our $100 billion portfolio of high-quality, long-life energy infrastructure assets are expected to generate record financial results again in 2019 underpinned by strong market fundamentals," said Russ Girling, TC Energy's president and chief executive officer. These utility operations have customers in eight states and expect customer growth to continue at a rate of 1-2% annually. The anticipated investment reflects opportunities to improve the safety and reliability of the company's systems. Also included in the utility's five-year program is the construction of an 88-megawatt simple-cycle, natural gas-fired combustion turbine near Mandan, North Dakota.The capital investment plan at the pipeline and midstream business reflects a focus on organic growth. This includes the Demicks Lake Expansion project under construction in North Dakota, which is expected to be in service in the first quarter of 2020 and as designed will increase capacity by 175 mln cubic feet per day. The North Bakken Expansion project is also included in the capital forecast. As designed, this project in the heart of the Bakken will increase capacity by an estimated 350 mln cubic feet per day and is expected to be in service in late 2021. This business is exploring additional organic growth projects that, if executed, would be incremental to the capital investment plan. Natural gas production continues at record levels in the Bakken, driving the need for additional infrastructure.At the company's construction materials and services businesses, the capital expenditures forecast is focused primarily on organic expansion opportunities, normal equipment and plant replacements and upgrades. Included in the outlined forecast is the development of Knife River's Honey Creek Quarry in Texas, which includes the construction of a rock-crushing plant and the purchase of aggregate railcars. The Russell 2000 (-0.3%) closed in negative territory.The day began with the market digesting a tweet from a China-based CNBC reporter, who said she was informed by a Chinese government source that Beijing is pessimistic about a trade deal because President Trump hasn't supported a tariff rollback. Based on the modest losses and ensuing price action, the market presumably remained optimistic about a Phase One agreement.The large-cap indices eased their way into positive territory thanks to the turnarounds in the S&P 500 consumer discretionary (+0.3%), information technology (+0.3%), and communication services (+0.3%) sectors. Consistent leaders included the consumer staples (+0.5%) and real estate (+0.5%) sectors, as the negative-sounding trade headline likely fostered some conservative-minded interest.The trade-sensitive industrials (-0.3%) and materials (-0.2%) sectors were among today's laggards, but their losses were small compared to the 1.3% drop in the energy sector, which was pressured by the decline in oil prices ($57.04, -0.71, -1.2%).Generally, there wasn't any concerted effort to sell a market trading at all-time highs, but investors weren't eager to embrace risk, either. The trend has been positive, which has likely drawn in some reluctant investors into the market, and today simply may have been a natural breather for a market breaking out to new highs.Notable corporate news included HP Inc. (HPQ 20.01, -0.17, -0.8%) turning down the takeover bid from Xerox (XRX 39.30, +0.36, +0.9%). HP remained open to a deal, though. Netflix (NFLX 302.57, +7.54, +2.6%) shares outperformed on speculation that either Carl Icahn or Bill Ackman built a large stake in the company.U.S. Treasuries extended last week's advance, pushing yields slightly lower across the curve. The 2-yr yield declined two basis points to 1.59%, and the 10-yr yield declined three basis points to 1.81%. The U.S. Dollar Index declined 0.2% to 97.80.Separately, the NAHB Housing Market Index for November declined to 70 from 71 in October. Investors will receive Housing Starts and Building Permits for October on Tuesday.Nasdaq Composite +28.9% YTDS&P 500 +24.5% YTDDow Jones Industrial Average +20.2% YTDRussell 2000 +18.1% YTD16:21T AT&T: Sony (SNE) subsidiary Sony Pictures Entertainment acquires AT&T's minority stake in Game Show Network (39.63 +0.13)Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) and AT&T announced that SPE has acquired AT&T's minority stake in Game Show Network. We believe the expanded trial will provide meaningful clinical data to help patients, both nave to PTH and previously treated with PTH, and further demonstrate the value of our unique approach to product development."Briefing.com is the leading Internet provider of live market analysis for U.S. Stock, U.S. Bond and world FX market participants. 1-800-752-3013 or http://www.briefing.comLoad-Date: November 19, 2019End of Document

Their weakness has acted as a weight on the broader market, yet the movement of the S&P 500 index has been largely a function of technical price action.Briefing.com's Technical Take page identified 3127 as a secondary resistance level for the S&P 500. That level was tested with the opening move (3127.64) but quickly failed as steady selling eventually dropped the S&P 500 back to 3113.46 at this morning's low, which was reached just before 11:00 a.m. ET. That level fell within a secondary support level (3115/3112) that was also identified on the Technical Take Page.Traders, therefore, appear to be respecting these technical boundaries for now on a day that is devoid of any major macro news drivers, particularly as they relate to trade, and as it is suggested that the market is short-term overextended and due for a pullback.The Russell 2000 is up 0.4%; the Nasdaq Composite is up 0.3%; the S&P 500 is unchanged; and the Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.4%.11:51QCOM Qualcomm issues 3 year targets at Analyst Day (88.73 -1.78)From CFO's presentation at Analyst Day:3 year targets as earnings mix shift to QCT from QTLRevenue: QCT segment SAM: 10% CAGR, grow faster than SAM and Apple product revenues QTL: current run rate + Huawei resolution Operating margin: QCT grows to >20%; QTL: ~70%Summarizing Qualcomm opportunities: Mature handset industry and current macroeconomic environment; Accelerated 5G migration compared to 4G; Mobile handset platform: 4G->5G transition, RF Front-End growth; Growth beyond mobile: Auto, IoT, Compute, ADAS, Cloud/Edge AI 75+ 5G licenses including key anchor agreements.Grow earnings faster than revenues. CEO Mollenkopf just appeared on CNBC.11:35GMAB Genmab granted marketing authorization from the European Commission for DARZALEX (daratumumab) in combination with lenalidomide and dexamethasone as treatment for adult patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma who are ineligible for autologous stem cell transplant (22.61 -0.09)DARZALEX was approved in Europe in combination with lenalidomide and dexamethasone as treatment for adult patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma who are ineligible for autologous stem cell transplant.Approval follows positive opinion by European Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) in October.Approval is based on data from Phase III MAIA study.11:29AGN Allergan announces publication of results from ACHIEVE II (UBR-MD-02) (185.09 +0.89)Positive results from ACHIEVE II (UBR-MD-02), a pivotal Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of ubrogepant, have been published in the November 19 issue of The Journal of the American Medical Association. The ACHIEVE II trial evaluated ubrogepant 50 mg and 25 mg, compared with placebo, across a wide range of clinical endpoints, including the co-primary endpoints of pain freedom (no pain) and freedom from the most bothersome migraine-associated symptom at two hours post-initial dose. For the two co-primary endpoints, ubrogepant 50 mg and 25 mg showed statistically significant higher response rates for pain freedom at two hours (21.8% for 50 mg, 20.7% for 25 mg and 14.3% for placebo), and the 50 mg dose demonstrated statistically significant higher response rates for the freedom from the most bothersome migraine-associated symptom at two hours (38.9% for 50 mg and 27.4% for placebo). Additionally, ubrogepant 50 mg was statistically superior to placebo in the absence of light sensitivity (43.8% for 50 mg and 35.5% for placebo) and sound sensitivity (54.1% for 50 mg and 46.3% for placebo).FDA action on the NDA for ubrogepant is expected in December 2019, potentially making it the first oral CGRP to address unmet patient needs in acute treatment of migraine and the first FDA-approved gepant.11:21XLE Sector Briefing: Energy (58.71 -0.65)The energy sector (-1.1%) sits at the bottom of today's sector standings after showing relative weakness yesterday. The growth-sensitive sector is now down 2.4% since Friday versus a much more modest 0.1% week-to-date downtick in the S&P 500. Factors contributing to the underperformance:Notable pressure on crude oil. The energy component is down more than $1.00 today (-2.3%) and down $2.01 (-3.5%) since Friday's settlement. This has sent the price of oil beneath its 200-day moving average (57.37) with the 50-day average (55.65) looming just below. Tax-loss related selling. The energy sector has been the weakest performer of 2019, meaning the group contains a fair share of names that have underperformed since the end of 2018. These names are more likely to be sold before the end of 2019 as investors look to reduce some of the tax impact of taking capital gains this year.Notable movers:HollyFrontier (HFC 51.56, -2.35, -4.4%): falling to its lowest level since early October. That corner is the retail industry, which has been broadsided today by disappointing earnings/sales results and guidance from Home Depot (HD 226.60, -12.25, -5.1%) and Kohl's (KSS 48.09, -10.31, -17.7%).The weakness in HD is having an outsized impact on the price-weighted Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&P 500 consumer discretionary sector (-0.9%); meanwhile, the combined impact of the disappointments from these well-known retailers is creating some angst about consumer spending activity entering the all-important holiday selling season.That angst is showing up in a sympathy trade that has knocked down the prices of many other retail stocks today, like Macy's (M 15.36, -1.51, -9.0%), Best Buy (BBY 75.61, -1.68, -2.2%), and Gap (GPS 16.62, -0.68, -3.9%) to name a few. The SPDR S&P Retail ETF (XRT 43.97, -0.85, -1.9%) reflects the broader trend of underperformance for the retailers in today's market action.Those issues notwithstanding, the broader market is still holding up just fine as it is drawing influential support from the information technology (+0.3%), healthcare (+0.3%), and financial (+0.2%) sectors, which continue to attract interest from value and growth-minded investors alike.Separately, the market's overall resilience to selling pressure remains a tying factor for a number of participants who are fearful of missing out on further gains. That fear, ostensibly, is lending some buying support that has kept downside pressure in check.The Russell 2000 is up 0.2%; the Nasdaq Composite is up 0.1%; the S&P 500 is down 0.1%; and the Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.2%.10:00XLY Sector Briefing: Consumer Discretionary (120.74 -1.05)The consumer discretionary sector (-0.8%) represents an early pocket of relative weakness in a flat market. The studies were conducted in mouse models of melanoma and of colon carcinoma, each of which was modified to partially deplete regulatory T cells; GPR174 deficiency in these mice resulted in significantly reduced tumor growth and improved survival of the animals (p=0.006 in melanoma; p=0.03 in colon cancer) versus normal mice.XBiotech (XBIT) today announced rapid enrollment in its Phase 2 clinical study evaluating bermekimab in patients with moderate to severe Hidradenitis Suppurativa. The study is will enroll approximately 150 patients. XBiotech announced the first patient enrolled in the study on October 23. Today, XBiotech is already updating status of the study, reporting that 51 patients have now been randomized, or assigned to an investigational arm of the study.Advanced Micro (AMD) announced the AMD Radeon Pro W5700, a 7nm professional PC workstation graphics card. It delivers new levels of performance and advanced features that enable 3D designers, architects, and engineers to visualize, review, and interact with their designs in real time, accelerating decision-making processes and product development cycles. Cree (CREE) and STMicroelectronics (STM) announced today the expansion and extension of an existing multi-year, long-term silicon carbide wafer supply agreement to more than $500 mln. The extended agreement is a doubling in value of the original agreement for the supply of Cree's advanced 150mm silicon carbide bare and epitaxial wafers to STMicroelectronics over the next several years.ConocoPhillips (COP) is hosting an Analyst & Investor Meeting today to reaffirm its commitment to the "disciplined, returns-focused" strategy it launched in 2016. The company will outline the details of a 2020-2029 operating and financial plan and will provide region and asset reviews of its global portfolio. Highlights of the 10-year plan include free cash flow of approximately $50 bln, a forecast for underlying compound annual production growth averaging over 3%, and a projection for $30 bln in share buybacks over the 10-year period.09:16ALV Autoliv provides mid-term and long-term targets at Investor Day (82.22 )Medium term (up to 3-5 years) targets: On average to grow sales organically* by 3-4% more per year than light vehicle production growth and the company aim to improve its adjusted operating margin* to around 12%, based on an assumed average light vehicle production growth of 1-2% per year.Long term (beyond 5 years) ambitions: Our ambition remains to grow at least in line with our market. When our ongoing and planned strategic initiatives are fully implemented, the ambition is to further increase our earnings capacity, to an adjusted operating margin* of around 13%.For 2020, Co states, "Potential tailwinds include raw material costs, organic growth from market share gains, positive impacts from ongoing cost reduction programs and a stabilization of light vehicle production. Potential headwinds include lower inflator replacement sales and higher depreciation and amortization. Nasdaq futures vs fair value: +34.10.U.S. equity-index futures continue to edge higher into record territory, even as shares of Home Depot (HD 227.25, -11.60, -4.9%) slide on disappointing quarterly results and guidance. The S&P 500 futures trade eight points, or 0.3%, above fair value.Home Depot missed revenue estimates and lowered its FY20 comparable sales guidance, but it wasn't the only retailer to disappoint. Shares of Kohl's (KSS 52.43, -5.97, -10.2%) have dropped 10% after it missed earnings estimates and lowered its full-year earnings guidance. Other retail stocks are currently trading lower in sympathy.Weakness in the retail space this morning is being offset by the gains in the market's largest technology stocks, namely Apple (AAPL 268.17, +1.07, +0.4%), Alphabet (GOOG 1326.00, +5.30, +0.4%), and Microsoft (MSFT 150.90, +0.56, +0.4%). In addition, the expectation for a Phase One trade deal has been supportive for the market's bullish bias.Today's economic calendar will feature Housing Starts (Briefing.com consensus 1.3 million) and Building Permits (Briefing.com consensus 1.365 million) for October at 8:30 a.m. ET.U.S. Treasuries are little changed. The 2-yr yield is up two basis points to 1.61%, and the 10-yr yield is unchanged at 1.81%. The U.S. Dollar Index is unchanged at 97.80. WTI crude is down 1.0%, or $0.56, to $56.49/bbl.In U.S. Corporate news:Home Depot (HD 227.25, -11.60): -4.9% after missing revenue estimates and lowering its FY20 comparable sales guidance. September Construction Output +0.74% m/m (last -0.82%)U.K.'s November CBI Industrial Trends Orders -26 (expected -31; prior -37)Italy's September Industrial New Orders +1.0% m/m (expected -1.5%; last 0.8%); +0.3% yr/yr (expected -3.9%; last -10.4%). September Industrial Sales +0.2% m/m (expected -0.4%; last -0.3%); -1.6% yr/yr (expected -1.0%; last -2.2%)Swiss October trade surplus CHF3.50 bln (last surplus of CHF4.05 bln)In news:Greek Prime Minister, Kyriakos Mitsotakis, called on Germany to increase its infrastructure spending while new IMF Managing Director, Kristalina Georgieva, said that countries with monetary policy space should take advantage of their position.New car registrations in the eurozone increased 8.7% yr/yr, representing the strongest growth rate in a decade.Car registrations through the first ten months of 2019 are down 0.7% yr/yr.07:35MYOV Myovant Sciences Phase 3 HERO study of once-daily, oral relugolix (120 mg) met its primary efficacy endpoint and all six key secondary endpoints in men with advanced prostate cancer (6.06 )The primary efficacy endpoint was met with 96.7% of men achieving sustained testosterone suppression to castrate levels (< 50 ng/dL) through 48 weeks. In the primary endpoint responder analysis, 96.7% (95% CI: 94.9%, 97.9%) of men receiving once-daily, oral relugolix achieved sustained testosterone suppression to castrate levels. A responder was defined as achieving and maintaining testosterone suppression to less than or equal to 50 ng/dL from Week 5 through Week 48. For the study to be successful, the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the response rate had to be at least 90%.The study achieved all six key secondary endpoints, including superiority to leuprolide acetate on rapid suppression of testosterone and prostate-specific antigen (PSA), all with p-values < 0.0001.Five key secondary endpoints demonstrated superiority to leuprolide acetate, including rapid suppression of testosterone at Day 4 and Day 15, profound suppression of testosterone at Day 15, rapid suppression of prostate-specific antigen (PSA) at Day 15, and suppression of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) at Week 24 (all p-values < 0.0001). In addition, relugolix demonstrated non-inferiority to leuprolide acetate on sustained testosterone suppression through 48 weeks (96.7% vs. 88.8%, respectively) with a between-group difference of 7.9% (95% CI: 4.1%,11.8%), the primary endpoint required for regulatory submissions outside of the U.S. In addition, the pharmacodynamic results showed no testosterone flare after initiation of relugolix and mean testosterone levels returned to normal levels within 90 days after treatment discontinuation.A New Drug Application (NDA) submission is expected in the second quarter of 2020.A conference call and webcast are to be held today at 8:30 a.m. EST / 5:30 a.m. PST.07:32SRRK Scholar Rock announces preliminary pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic results from the TOPAZ Phase 2 proof-of-concept trial of SRK-015 for the treatment of patients with spinal muscular atrophy (7.20 )The planned preliminary PK/PD analysis, which includes data from 29 patients with SMA across all three cohorts, showed dose-proportional drug exposure and demonstrated target engagement, as evidenced by dose-dependent increases of up to 100-fold in the serum levels of latent myostatin following SRK-015 treatment (2 mg/kg and 20 mg/kg doses). SRK-015 is a highly selective inhibitor of the precursor, or latent form, of myostatin, and was specifically designed to avoid interactions with related targets such as activins, GDF-11, or BMPs, to potentially improve the therapeutic profile compared to traditional non-selective inhibitors.07:31ACHN Achillion Pharma: EMA has granted access to support through the PRIME program for danicopan (ACH-4471) in the treatment of paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria in patients who are not adequately responding to a C5 inhibitor (6.26 )07:30ATI Allegheny Tech commences senior notes offering (23.58 )ATI intends to use the net proceeds from the offering, together with cash on hand, to fund a redemption of all of ATI's outstanding 5.950% Senior Notes due 2021 (the "2021 Notes"), of which $500.0 million aggregate principal amount is outstanding, in accordance with the terms of the indenture governing the 2021 Notes.07:30SUMRX European Markets Update: DAX +1.0%, FTSE +1.1%, CAC +0.3%Major European indices trade higher across the board. Michael is leaving for personal reasons, moving back to the United States, to be close to where his family is located and to pursue other career opportunities. CN has announced that Rob Reilly, executive vice-president and chief operating officer, will assume interim responsibility for the company's Information and Technology function, while the company carries out a global search for a chief information and technology officer.Shutterstock, Inc. (SSTK), announced the launch of an unlimited monthly subscription for Shutterstock Music. The new plan is geared toward digital content creators, including YouTubers, podcast producers, and social media managers, offering a cost-efficient solution to licensing unlimited high-quality tracks at $149 per month.Sangamo Therapeutics, Inc. (SGMO), announced that the United Kingdom's (UK) Medicines Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) has granted authorization of the first-in-human clinical trial to evaluate a Chimeric Antigen Receptor Regulatory T Cell (CAR-Treg) therapy. TX200 is being studied for the prevention of immune-mediated rejection following HLA-A2 mismatched kidney transplantation for end-stage renal disease (ESRD). Sangamo expects to open the first clinical sites for the STEADFAST study in 2020.Inter Parfums, Inc. (IPAR) announced that it has entered into an exclusive, 10-year worldwide license agreement with German luxury fashion house MCM for the creation, development and distribution of fragrances under the MCM brand.Viking Therapeutics, Inc. (VKTX), announced the initiation of a Phase 2b clinical trial of VK2809, its novel liver-selective thyroid hormone receptor beta agonist, in patients with biopsy-confirmed non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). Clinical trial sites are open for patient enrollment following clearance of the company's Investigational New Drug (IND) application by the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA).07:04KSS Kohl's misses by $0.12, beats on revs; lowers FY20 EPS below consensus (58.40 )Reports Q3 (Oct) earnings of $0.74 per share, $0.12 worse than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.86; revenues rose 5.9% year/year to $4.63 bln vs the $4.4 bln S&P Capital IQ Consensus.Q3 comparable sales increased 0.4% Co issues downside guidance for FY20, sees EPS of $4.75-4.95 vs. $5.19 S&P Capital IQ Consensus, compared to prior guidance of $5.15-5.45.07:04NJR NJ Resources reports EPS in-line, misses on revs; guides FY20 EPS just below consensus (41.71 )Reports Q4 (Sep) earnings of $0.29 per share, excluding non-recurring items, in-line with the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.29; revenues fell 26.0% year/year to $479.08 mln vs the $694.5 mln two analyst estimate. Co issues downside guidance for FY20, sees EPS of $2.05-2.15, excluding non-recurring items, vs. $2.17 median S&P Capital IQ estimate.07:02AUY Yamana Gold announced exploration results for the Cerro Moro mine in Argentina (3.50 )Exploration HighlightsDiscovery of a new mineralized zone. Drill intercepts are helping to define a significant new mineralized zone along the Naty structure, located 25 kilometres south of the core mine.Significant results from new exploration drilling in core mine area. High-grade intercepts in the Nini Extension, Tres Lomas, Michelle, and Deborah sectors.Encountering high grades in the Martina and Escondida sectors. Select drill intercepts exceed 100 grams per tonne ("g/t") of gold.Exploration program extended to entire Cerro Moro concession. Program now covers the full 150,000-hectare land package.07:01CRSP CRISPR Therapeutics and Vertex (VRTX) announce data from the first two patients with severe hemoglobinopathies treated with the investigational CRISPR/Cas9 gene-editing therapy CTX001 in ongoing Phase 1/2 clinical trials (58.53 )The patient with TDT has the 0/IVS-I-110 genotype and required 16.5 transfusions per year (annualized rate during the two years prior to consenting for the study) before enrolling in the clinical study. The patient achieved neutrophil engraftment 33 days after CTX001 infusion and platelet engraftment 37 days after infusion. Two serious adverse events (SAEs) occurred, neither of which the principal investigator (PI) considered related to CTX001: pneumonia in the presence of neutropenia and veno-occlusive liver disease attributed to busulfan conditioning; both subsequently resolved. At nine months after CTX001 infusion, the patient was transfusion independent and had total hemoglobin levels of 11.9 g/dL, 10.1 g/dL fetal hemoglobin, and 99.8% F-cells (erythrocytes expressing fetal hemoglobin).The patient with SCD experienced seven vaso-occlusive crises (VOCs) per year (annualized rate during the two years prior to consenting for the study) before enrolling in the clinical study. The patient achieved neutrophil and platelet engraftment 30 days after CTX001 infusion. Three SAEs occurred, none of which the PI considered related to CTX001: sepsis in the presence of neutropenia, cholelithiasis, and abdominal pain, all of which resolved. At four months after CTX001 infusion, the patient was free of VOCs and had total hemoglobin levels of 11.3 g/dL, 46.6% fetal hemoglobin, and 94.7% F-cells (erythrocytes expressing fetal hemoglobin).07:01ALKS Alkermes submits New Drug Application to the FDA seeking approval of ALKS 3831 (olanzapine/samidorphan) for the treatment of schizophrenia and for the treatment of bipolar I disorder (20.16 )07:00SUMRX Asian Markets Close: Nikkei -0.5%, Hang Seng +1.6%, Shanghai +0.9%Equity indices in the Asia-Pacific region ended Tuesday on a mostly higher note. If current exchange rates hold, revenue growth in fiscal year 2020 would be negatively affected by 0.8 to 1.2%.06:52WIRES On The WiresBoeing (BA) and the Republic of Ghana announced today that the country intends to re-launch an airline starting with the 787-9 Dreamliner. This is within the Company's previous guidance for loan originations facilitated by institutional partners to be in the range of RMB32 billion to RMB38 billion for the second half of 2019.The Company plans to discontinue its online information intermediary business between individual borrowers and individual investors, that is the part of FinVolution's business in which loans on the Company's platform are facilitated by individual investors. The Company will continue its strategy of expanding loan facilitations on the platform by institutional funding partners. In the third quarter of 2019, loan originations facilitated by institutional partners increased to 75.1% of total loan origination volume, and the Company expects this proportion to further increase in the fourth quarter of 2019. As the Company's business model of loan facilitation by institutional funding partners has a relatively short operating history, the Company's operations and future growth may be subject to uncertainty.At its 2019 annual general meeting of shareholders held on 5th November, shareholders of the Company adopted the following resolution as a special resolution proposed by the Company that the name of the Company be changed from "PPDAI Group Inc." to "FinVolution Group". Khoury, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of KLX Energy Services commented, "Contemporaneously with the abrupt decline in activity, we took steps to align our business with current customer demand. Specifically, we implemented an approximate 17 percent reduction in force, as compared with the Company's July 31, 2019 staffing levels, consistent with the approximate 18 percent sequential quarterly decline in our third quarter revenues. We aggressively cut costs in every area of our business, and we warm stacked the vast majority of our Permian based wireline assets. As a result of these and other measures, we expect to take a third quarter charge of approximately $13 million. Notwithstanding the precipitous decline in industry conditions, we generated approximately $44 million in cash flow from operations and approximately $31 million in free cash flow, bringing our cash balance to approximately $121 million for the quarter ended October 31, 2019. In addition, our $100 million credit facility remains undrawn.""The abrupt deterioration in industry conditions, which accelerated through the end of our third quarter, was driven by a sharp sequential quarterly decline in U.S. land rig count and an unprecedented decline in active frac spreads from the second quarter to the third quarter. In fact, there was a significant sequential decline in hydraulic fracturing activity during each month of the third quarter. The decline in Exploration & Production activity resulted in lower demand levels and lower current and expected revenues for our business, which led the Company to accelerate its annual testing for asset impairment into the third quarter. While the Company has not yet completed this analysis, we expect to report a non-cash asset impairment charge in the range of approximately $45 million to $60 million. The Company is in the process of finalizing the actual amount of the impairment charge, which will be completed prior to reporting its third quarter financial results."06:00CEO CNOOC Ltd names President Xu Keqiang as CEO (152.50 )06:00TRP TC Energy to provide financial update and review strategic plans at Investor Day, reaffirms expectation to grow common share dividend at an annual rate of 8-10% through 2021 (51.44 )"Our $100 billion portfolio of high-quality, long-life energy infrastructure assets are expected to generate record financial results again in 2019 underpinned by strong market fundamentals," said Russ Girling, TC Energy's president and chief executive officer. These utility operations have customers in eight states and expect customer growth to continue at a rate of 1-2% annually. The anticipated investment reflects opportunities to improve the safety and reliability of the company's systems. Also included in the utility's five-year program is the construction of an 88-megawatt simple-cycle, natural gas-fired combustion turbine near Mandan, North Dakota.The capital investment plan at the pipeline and midstream business reflects a focus on organic growth. This includes the Demicks Lake Expansion project under construction in North Dakota, which is expected to be in service in the first quarter of 2020 and as designed will increase capacity by 175 mln cubic feet per day. The North Bakken Expansion project is also included in the capital forecast. As designed, this project in the heart of the Bakken will increase capacity by an estimated 350 mln cubic feet per day and is expected to be in service in late 2021. This business is exploring additional organic growth projects that, if executed, would be incremental to the capital investment plan. Natural gas production continues at record levels in the Bakken, driving the need for additional infrastructure.At the company's construction materials and services businesses, the capital expenditures forecast is focused primarily on organic expansion opportunities, normal equipment and plant replacements and upgrades. Included in the outlined forecast is the development of Knife River's Honey Creek Quarry in Texas, which includes the construction of a rock-crushing plant and the purchase of aggregate railcars. The company expects public sector workload growth as new state and local infrastructure spending initiatives are introduced.16:44ZG Zillow announced that Greg Schwartz, president of media and marketplaces, is stepping down to take a professional break (39.74 +0.23)The businesses that currently report to Schwartz in the Mortgages and Internet, Media and Technology (IMT) segments are being transitioned to other senior executives. The Russell 2000 (-0.3%) closed in negative territory.The day began with the market digesting a tweet from a China-based CNBC reporter, who said she was informed by a Chinese government source that Beijing is pessimistic about a trade deal because President Trump hasn't supported a tariff rollback. Based on the modest losses and ensuing price action, the market presumably remained optimistic about a Phase One agreement.The large-cap indices eased their way into positive territory thanks to the turnarounds in the S&P 500 consumer discretionary (+0.3%), information technology (+0.3%), and communication services (+0.3%) sectors. Consistent leaders included the consumer staples (+0.5%) and real estate (+0.5%) sectors, as the negative-sounding trade headline likely fostered some conservative-minded interest.The trade-sensitive industrials (-0.3%) and materials (-0.2%) sectors were among today's laggards, but their losses were small compared to the 1.3% drop in the energy sector, which was pressured by the decline in oil prices ($57.04, -0.71, -1.2%).Generally, there wasn't any concerted effort to sell a market trading at all-time highs, but investors weren't eager to embrace risk, either. The trend has been positive, which has likely drawn in some reluctant investors into the market, and today simply may have been a natural breather for a market breaking out to new highs.Notable corporate news included HP Inc. (HPQ 20.01, -0.17, -0.8%) turning down the takeover bid from Xerox (XRX 39.30, +0.36, +0.9%). HP remained open to a deal, though. Netflix (NFLX 302.57, +7.54, +2.6%) shares outperformed on speculation that either Carl Icahn or Bill Ackman built a large stake in the company.U.S. Treasuries extended last week's advance, pushing yields slightly lower across the curve. The 2-yr yield declined two basis points to 1.59%, and the 10-yr yield declined three basis points to 1.81%. The U.S. Dollar Index declined 0.2% to 97.80.Separately, the NAHB Housing Market Index for November declined to 70 from 71 in October. Investors will receive Housing Starts and Building Permits for October on Tuesday.Nasdaq Composite +28.9% YTDS&P 500 +24.5% YTDDow Jones Industrial Average +20.2% YTDRussell 2000 +18.1% YTD16:21T AT&T: Sony (SNE) subsidiary Sony Pictures Entertainment acquires AT&T's minority stake in Game Show Network (39.63 +0.13)Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) and AT&T announced that SPE has acquired AT&T's minority stake in Game Show Network. Prior to the transaction, SPE owned a 58% stake in Game Show Network, and AT&T owned the remaining 42%. Their weakness has acted as a weight on the broader market, yet the movement of the S&P 500 index has been largely a function of technical price action.Briefing.com's Technical Take page identified 3127 as a secondary resistance level for the S&P 500. That level was tested with the opening move (3127.64) but quickly failed as steady selling eventually dropped the S&P 500 back to 3113.46 at this morning's low, which was reached just before 11:00 a.m. ET. That level fell within a secondary support level (3115/3112) that was also identified on the Technical Take Page.Traders, therefore, appear to be respecting these technical boundaries for now on a day that is devoid of any major macro news drivers, particularly as they relate to trade, and as it is suggested that the market is short-term overextended and due for a pullback.The Russell 2000 is up 0.4%; the Nasdaq Composite is up 0.3%; the S&P 500 is unchanged; and the Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.4%.11:51QCOM Qualcomm issues 3 year targets at Analyst Day (88.73 -1.78)From CFO's presentation at Analyst Day:3 year targets as earnings mix shift to QCT from QTLRevenue: QCT segment SAM: 10% CAGR, grow faster than SAM and Apple product revenues QTL: current run rate + Huawei resolution Operating margin: QCT grows to >20%; QTL: ~70%Summarizing Qualcomm opportunities: Mature handset industry and current macroeconomic environment; Accelerated 5G migration compared to 4G; Mobile handset platform: 4G->5G transition, RF Front-End growth; Growth beyond mobile: Auto, IoT, Compute, ADAS, Cloud/Edge AI 75+ 5G licenses including key anchor agreements.Grow earnings faster than revenues. CEO Mollenkopf just appeared on CNBC.11:35GMAB Genmab granted marketing authorization from the European Commission for DARZALEX (daratumumab) in combination with lenalidomide and dexamethasone as treatment for adult patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma who are ineligible for autologous stem cell transplant (22.61 -0.09)DARZALEX was approved in Europe in combination with lenalidomide and dexamethasone as treatment for adult patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma who are ineligible for autologous stem cell transplant.Approval follows positive opinion by European Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) in October.Approval is based on data from Phase III MAIA study.11:29AGN Allergan announces publication of results from ACHIEVE II (UBR-MD-02) (185.09 +0.89)Positive results from ACHIEVE II (UBR-MD-02), a pivotal Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of ubrogepant, have been published in the November 19 issue of The Journal of the American Medical Association. The ACHIEVE II trial evaluated ubrogepant 50 mg and 25 mg, compared with placebo, across a wide range of clinical endpoints, including the co-primary endpoints of pain freedom (no pain) and freedom from the most bothersome migraine-associated symptom at two hours post-initial dose. For the two co-primary endpoints, ubrogepant 50 mg and 25 mg showed statistically significant higher response rates for pain freedom at two hours (21.8% for 50 mg, 20.7% for 25 mg and 14.3% for placebo), and the 50 mg dose demonstrated statistically significant higher response rates for the freedom from the most bothersome migraine-associated symptom at two hours (38.9% for 50 mg and 27.4% for placebo). Additionally, ubrogepant 50 mg was statistically superior to placebo in the absence of light sensitivity (43.8% for 50 mg and 35.5% for placebo) and sound sensitivity (54.1% for 50 mg and 46.3% for placebo).FDA action on the NDA for ubrogepant is expected in December 2019, potentially making it the first oral CGRP to address unmet patient needs in acute treatment of migraine and the first FDA-approved gepant.11:21XLE Sector Briefing: Energy (58.71 -0.65)The energy sector (-1.1%) sits at the bottom of today's sector standings after showing relative weakness yesterday. The growth-sensitive sector is now down 2.4% since Friday versus a much more modest 0.1% week-to-date downtick in the S&P 500. Factors contributing to the underperformance:Notable pressure on crude oil. The energy component is down more than $1.00 today (-2.3%) and down $2.01 (-3.5%) since Friday's settlement. This has sent the price of oil beneath its 200-day moving average (57.37) with the 50-day average (55.65) looming just below. Tax-loss related selling. The energy sector has been the weakest performer of 2019, meaning the group contains a fair share of names that have underperformed since the end of 2018. These names are more likely to be sold before the end of 2019 as investors look to reduce some of the tax impact of taking capital gains this year.Notable movers:HollyFrontier (HFC 51.56, -2.35, -4.4%): falling to its lowest level since early October. That corner is the retail industry, which has been broadsided today by disappointing earnings/sales results and guidance from Home Depot (HD 226.60, -12.25, -5.1%) and Kohl's (KSS 48.09, -10.31, -17.7%).The weakness in HD is having an outsized impact on the price-weighted Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&P 500 consumer discretionary sector (-0.9%); meanwhile, the combined impact of the disappointments from these well-known retailers is creating some angst about consumer spending activity entering the all-important holiday selling season.That angst is showing up in a sympathy trade that has knocked down the prices of many other retail stocks today, like Macy's (M 15.36, -1.51, -9.0%), Best Buy (BBY 75.61, -1.68, -2.2%), and Gap (GPS 16.62, -0.68, -3.9%) to name a few. The SPDR S&P Retail ETF (XRT 43.97, -0.85, -1.9%) reflects the broader trend of underperformance for the retailers in today's market action.Those issues notwithstanding, the broader market is still holding up just fine as it is drawing influential support from the information technology (+0.3%), healthcare (+0.3%), and financial (+0.2%) sectors, which continue to attract interest from value and growth-minded investors alike.Separately, the market's overall resilience to selling pressure remains a tying factor for a number of participants who are fearful of missing out on further gains. That fear, ostensibly, is lending some buying support that has kept downside pressure in check.The Russell 2000 is up 0.2%; the Nasdaq Composite is up 0.1%; the S&P 500 is down 0.1%; and the Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.2%.10:00XLY Sector Briefing: Consumer Discretionary (120.74 -1.05)The consumer discretionary sector (-0.8%) represents an early pocket of relative weakness in a flat market. The studies were conducted in mouse models of melanoma and of colon carcinoma, each of which was modified to partially deplete regulatory T cells; GPR174 deficiency in these mice resulted in significantly reduced tumor growth and improved survival of the animals (p=0.006 in melanoma; p=0.03 in colon cancer) versus normal mice.XBiotech (XBIT) today announced rapid enrollment in its Phase 2 clinical study evaluating bermekimab in patients with moderate to severe Hidradenitis Suppurativa. The study is will enroll approximately 150 patients. XBiotech announced the first patient enrolled in the study on October 23. Today, XBiotech is already updating status of the study, reporting that 51 patients have now been randomized, or assigned to an investigational arm of the study.Advanced Micro (AMD) announced the AMD Radeon Pro W5700, a 7nm professional PC workstation graphics card. It delivers new levels of performance and advanced features that enable 3D designers, architects, and engineers to visualize, review, and interact with their designs in real time, accelerating decision-making processes and product development cycles. Cree (CREE) and STMicroelectronics (STM) announced today the expansion and extension of an existing multi-year, long-term silicon carbide wafer supply agreement to more than $500 mln. The extended agreement is a doubling in value of the original agreement for the supply of Cree's advanced 150mm silicon carbide bare and epitaxial wafers to STMicroelectronics over the next several years.ConocoPhillips (COP) is hosting an Analyst & Investor Meeting today to reaffirm its commitment to the "disciplined, returns-focused" strategy it launched in 2016. The company will outline the details of a 2020-2029 operating and financial plan and will provide region and asset reviews of its global portfolio. Highlights of the 10-year plan include free cash flow of approximately $50 bln, a forecast for underlying compound annual production growth averaging over 3%, and a projection for $30 bln in share buybacks over the 10-year period.09:16ALV Autoliv provides mid-term and long-term targets at Investor Day (82.22 )Medium term (up to 3-5 years) targets: On average to grow sales organically* by 3-4% more per year than light vehicle production growth and the company aim to improve its adjusted operating margin* to around 12%, based on an assumed average light vehicle production growth of 1-2% per year.Long term (beyond 5 years) ambitions: Our ambition remains to grow at least in line with our market. When our ongoing and planned strategic initiatives are fully implemented, the ambition is to further increase our earnings capacity, to an adjusted operating margin* of around 13%.For 2020, Co states, "Potential tailwinds include raw material costs, organic growth from market share gains, positive impacts from ongoing cost reduction programs and a stabilization of light vehicle production. Potential headwinds include lower inflator replacement sales and higher depreciation and amortization. Nasdaq futures vs fair value: +34.10.U.S. equity-index futures continue to edge higher into record territory, even as shares of Home Depot (HD 227.25, -11.60, -4.9%) slide on disappointing quarterly results and guidance. The S&P 500 futures trade eight points, or 0.3%, above fair value.Home Depot missed revenue estimates and lowered its FY20 comparable sales guidance, but it wasn't the only retailer to disappoint. Shares of Kohl's (KSS 52.43, -5.97, -10.2%) have dropped 10% after it missed earnings estimates and lowered its full-year earnings guidance. Other retail stocks are currently trading lower in sympathy.Weakness in the retail space this morning is being offset by the gains in the market's largest technology stocks, namely Apple (AAPL 268.17, +1.07, +0.4%), Alphabet (GOOG 1326.00, +5.30, +0.4%), and Microsoft (MSFT 150.90, +0.56, +0.4%). In addition, the expectation for a Phase One trade deal has been supportive for the market's bullish bias.Today's economic calendar will feature Housing Starts (Briefing.com consensus 1.3 million) and Building Permits (Briefing.com consensus 1.365 million) for October at 8:30 a.m. ET.U.S. Treasuries are little changed. The 2-yr yield is up two basis points to 1.61%, and the 10-yr yield is unchanged at 1.81%. The U.S. Dollar Index is unchanged at 97.80. WTI crude is down 1.0%, or $0.56, to $56.49/bbl.In U.S. Corporate news:Home Depot (HD 227.25, -11.60): -4.9% after missing revenue estimates and lowering its FY20 comparable sales guidance. September Construction Output +0.74% m/m (last -0.82%)U.K.'s November CBI Industrial Trends Orders -26 (expected -31; prior -37)Italy's September Industrial New Orders +1.0% m/m (expected -1.5%; last 0.8%); +0.3% yr/yr (expected -3.9%; last -10.4%). September Industrial Sales +0.2% m/m (expected -0.4%; last -0.3%); -1.6% yr/yr (expected -1.0%; last -2.2%)Swiss October trade surplus CHF3.50 bln (last surplus of CHF4.05 bln)In news:Greek Prime Minister, Kyriakos Mitsotakis, called on Germany to increase its infrastructure spending while new IMF Managing Director, Kristalina Georgieva, said that countries with monetary policy space should take advantage of their position.New car registrations in the eurozone increased 8.7% yr/yr, representing the strongest growth rate in a decade.Car registrations through the first ten months of 2019 are down 0.7% yr/yr.07:35MYOV Myovant Sciences Phase 3 HERO study of once-daily, oral relugolix (120 mg) met its primary efficacy endpoint and all six key secondary endpoints in men with advanced prostate cancer (6.06 )The primary efficacy endpoint was met with 96.7% of men achieving sustained testosterone suppression to castrate levels (< 50 ng/dL) through 48 weeks. In the primary endpoint responder analysis, 96.7% (95% CI: 94.9%, 97.9%) of men receiving once-daily, oral relugolix achieved sustained testosterone suppression to castrate levels. A responder was defined as achieving and maintaining testosterone suppression to less than or equal to 50 ng/dL from Week 5 through Week 48. For the study to be successful, the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the response rate had to be at least 90%.The study achieved all six key secondary endpoints, including superiority to leuprolide acetate on rapid suppression of testosterone and prostate-specific antigen (PSA), all with p-values < 0.0001.Five key secondary endpoints demonstrated superiority to leuprolide acetate, including rapid suppression of testosterone at Day 4 and Day 15, profound suppression of testosterone at Day 15, rapid suppression of prostate-specific antigen (PSA) at Day 15, and suppression of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) at Week 24 (all p-values < 0.0001). In addition, relugolix demonstrated non-inferiority to leuprolide acetate on sustained testosterone suppression through 48 weeks (96.7% vs. 88.8%, respectively) with a between-group difference of 7.9% (95% CI: 4.1%,11.8%), the primary endpoint required for regulatory submissions outside of the U.S. In addition, the pharmacodynamic results showed no testosterone flare after initiation of relugolix and mean testosterone levels returned to normal levels within 90 days after treatment discontinuation.A New Drug Application (NDA) submission is expected in the second quarter of 2020.A conference call and webcast are to be held today at 8:30 a.m. EST / 5:30 a.m. PST.07:32SRRK Scholar Rock announces preliminary pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic results from the TOPAZ Phase 2 proof-of-concept trial of SRK-015 for the treatment of patients with spinal muscular atrophy (7.20 )The planned preliminary PK/PD analysis, which includes data from 29 patients with SMA across all three cohorts, showed dose-proportional drug exposure and demonstrated target engagement, as evidenced by dose-dependent increases of up to 100-fold in the serum levels of latent myostatin following SRK-015 treatment (2 mg/kg and 20 mg/kg doses). SRK-015 is a highly selective inhibitor of the precursor, or latent form, of myostatin, and was specifically designed to avoid interactions with related targets such as activins, GDF-11, or BMPs, to potentially improve the therapeutic profile compared to traditional non-selective inhibitors.07:31ACHN Achillion Pharma: EMA has granted access to support through the PRIME program for danicopan (ACH-4471) in the treatment of paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria in patients who are not adequately responding to a C5 inhibitor (6.26 )07:30ATI Allegheny Tech commences senior notes offering (23.58 )ATI intends to use the net proceeds from the offering, together with cash on hand, to fund a redemption of all of ATI's outstanding 5.950% Senior Notes due 2021 (the "2021 Notes"), of which $500.0 million aggregate principal amount is outstanding, in accordance with the terms of the indenture governing the 2021 Notes.07:30SUMRX European Markets Update: DAX +1.0%, FTSE +1.1%, CAC +0.3%Major European indices trade higher across the board. Michael is leaving for personal reasons, moving back to the United States, to be close to where his family is located and to pursue other career opportunities. CN has announced that Rob Reilly, executive vice-president and chief operating officer, will assume interim responsibility for the company's Information and Technology function, while the company carries out a global search for a chief information and technology officer.Shutterstock, Inc. (SSTK), announced the launch of an unlimited monthly subscription for Shutterstock Music. The new plan is geared toward digital content creators, including YouTubers, podcast producers, and social media managers, offering a cost-efficient solution to licensing unlimited high-quality tracks at $149 per month.Sangamo Therapeutics, Inc. (SGMO), announced that the United Kingdom's (UK) Medicines Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) has granted authorization of the first-in-human clinical trial to evaluate a Chimeric Antigen Receptor Regulatory T Cell (CAR-Treg) therapy. TX200 is being studied for the prevention of immune-mediated rejection following HLA-A2 mismatched kidney transplantation for end-stage renal disease (ESRD). Sangamo expects to open the first clinical sites for the STEADFAST study in 2020.Inter Parfums, Inc. (IPAR) announced that it has entered into an exclusive, 10-year worldwide license agreement with German luxury fashion house MCM for the creation, development and distribution of fragrances under the MCM brand.Viking Therapeutics, Inc. (VKTX), announced the initiation of a Phase 2b clinical trial of VK2809, its novel liver-selective thyroid hormone receptor beta agonist, in patients with biopsy-confirmed non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). Clinical trial sites are open for patient enrollment following clearance of the company's Investigational New Drug (IND) application by the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA).07:04KSS Kohl's misses by $0.12, beats on revs; lowers FY20 EPS below consensus (58.40 )Reports Q3 (Oct) earnings of $0.74 per share, $0.12 worse than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.86; revenues rose 5.9% year/year to $4.63 bln vs the $4.4 bln S&P Capital IQ Consensus.Q3 comparable sales increased 0.4% Co issues downside guidance for FY20, sees EPS of $4.75-4.95 vs. $5.19 S&P Capital IQ Consensus, compared to prior guidance of $5.15-5.45.07:04NJR NJ Resources reports EPS in-line, misses on revs; guides FY20 EPS just below consensus (41.71 )Reports Q4 (Sep) earnings of $0.29 per share, excluding non-recurring items, in-line with the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.29; revenues fell 26.0% year/year to $479.08 mln vs the $694.5 mln two analyst estimate. Co issues downside guidance for FY20, sees EPS of $2.05-2.15, excluding non-recurring items, vs. $2.17 median S&P Capital IQ estimate.07:02AUY Yamana Gold announced exploration results for the Cerro Moro mine in Argentina (3.50 )Exploration HighlightsDiscovery of a new mineralized zone. Drill intercepts are helping to define a significant new mineralized zone along the Naty structure, located 25 kilometres south of the core mine.Significant results from new exploration drilling in core mine area. High-grade intercepts in the Nini Extension, Tres Lomas, Michelle, and Deborah sectors.Encountering high grades in the Martina and Escondida sectors. Select drill intercepts exceed 100 grams per tonne ("g/t") of gold.Exploration program extended to entire Cerro Moro concession. Program now covers the full 150,000-hectare land package.07:01CRSP CRISPR Therapeutics and Vertex (VRTX) announce data from the first two patients with severe hemoglobinopathies treated with the investigational CRISPR/Cas9 gene-editing therapy CTX001 in ongoing Phase 1/2 clinical trials (58.53 )The patient with TDT has the 0/IVS-I-110 genotype and required 16.5 transfusions per year (annualized rate during the two years prior to consenting for the study) before enrolling in the clinical study. The patient achieved neutrophil engraftment 33 days after CTX001 infusion and platelet engraftment 37 days after infusion. Two serious adverse events (SAEs) occurred, neither of which the principal investigator (PI) considered related to CTX001: pneumonia in the presence of neutropenia and veno-occlusive liver disease attributed to busulfan conditioning; both subsequently resolved. At nine months after CTX001 infusion, the patient was transfusion independent and had total hemoglobin levels of 11.9 g/dL, 10.1 g/dL fetal hemoglobin, and 99.8% F-cells (erythrocytes expressing fetal hemoglobin).The patient with SCD experienced seven vaso-occlusive crises (VOCs) per year (annualized rate during the two years prior to consenting for the study) before enrolling in the clinical study. The patient achieved neutrophil and platelet engraftment 30 days after CTX001 infusion. Three SAEs occurred, none of which the PI considered related to CTX001: sepsis in the presence of neutropenia, cholelithiasis, and abdominal pain, all of which resolved. At four months after CTX001 infusion, the patient was free of VOCs and had total hemoglobin levels of 11.3 g/dL, 46.6% fetal hemoglobin, and 94.7% F-cells (erythrocytes expressing fetal hemoglobin).07:01ALKS Alkermes submits New Drug Application to the FDA seeking approval of ALKS 3831 (olanzapine/samidorphan) for the treatment of schizophrenia and for the treatment of bipolar I disorder (20.16 )07:00SUMRX Asian Markets Close: Nikkei -0.5%, Hang Seng +1.6%, Shanghai +0.9%Equity indices in the Asia-Pacific region ended Tuesday on a mostly higher note. If current exchange rates hold, revenue growth in fiscal year 2020 would be negatively affected by 0.8 to 1.2%.06:52WIRES On The WiresBoeing (BA) and the Republic of Ghana announced today that the country intends to re-launch an airline starting with the 787-9 Dreamliner. This is within the Company's previous guidance for loan originations facilitated by institutional partners to be in the range of RMB32 billion to RMB38 billion for the second half of 2019.The Company plans to discontinue its online information intermediary business between individual borrowers and individual investors, that is the part of FinVolution's business in which loans on the Company's platform are facilitated by individual investors. The Company will continue its strategy of expanding loan facilitations on the platform by institutional funding partners. In the third quarter of 2019, loan originations facilitated by institutional partners increased to 75.1% of total loan origination volume, and the Company expects this proportion to further increase in the fourth quarter of 2019. As the Company's business model of loan facilitation by institutional funding partners has a relatively short operating history, the Company's operations and future growth may be subject to uncertainty.At its 2019 annual general meeting of shareholders held on 5th November, shareholders of the Company adopted the following resolution as a special resolution proposed by the Company that the name of the Company be changed from "PPDAI Group Inc." to "FinVolution Group". Khoury, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of KLX Energy Services commented, "Contemporaneously with the abrupt decline in activity, we took steps to align our business with current customer demand. Specifically, we implemented an approximate 17 percent reduction in force, as compared with the Company's July 31, 2019 staffing levels, consistent with the approximate 18 percent sequential quarterly decline in our third quarter revenues. We aggressively cut costs in every area of our business, and we warm stacked the vast majority of our Permian based wireline assets. As a result of these and other measures, we expect to take a third quarter charge of approximately $13 million. Notwithstanding the precipitous decline in industry conditions, we generated approximately $44 million in cash flow from operations and approximately $31 million in free cash flow, bringing our cash balance to approximately $121 million for the quarter ended October 31, 2019. In addition, our $100 million credit facility remains undrawn.""The abrupt deterioration in industry conditions, which accelerated through the end of our third quarter, was driven by a sharp sequential quarterly decline in U.S. land rig count and an unprecedented decline in active frac spreads from the second quarter to the third quarter. In fact, there was a significant sequential decline in hydraulic fracturing activity during each month of the third quarter. The decline in Exploration & Production activity resulted in lower demand levels and lower current and expected revenues for our business, which led the Company to accelerate its annual testing for asset impairment into the third quarter. While the Company has not yet completed this analysis, we expect to report a non-cash asset impairment charge in the range of approximately $45 million to $60 million. The Company is in the process of finalizing the actual amount of the impairment charge, which will be completed prior to reporting its third quarter financial results."06:00CEO CNOOC Ltd names President Xu Keqiang as CEO (152.50 )06:00TRP TC Energy to provide financial update and review strategic plans at Investor Day, reaffirms expectation to grow common share dividend at an annual rate of 8-10% through 2021 (51.44 )"Our $100 billion portfolio of high-quality, long-life energy infrastructure assets are expected to generate record financial results again in 2019 underpinned by strong market fundamentals," said Russ Girling, TC Energy's president and chief executive officer. The anticipated investment reflects opportunities to improve the safety and reliability of the company's systems. Also included in the utility's five-year program is the construction of an 88-megawatt simple-cycle, natural gas-fired combustion turbine near Mandan, North Dakota.The capital investment plan at the pipeline and midstream business reflects a focus on organic growth. This includes the Demicks Lake Expansion project under construction in North Dakota, which is expected to be in service in the first quarter of 2020 and as designed will increase capacity by 175 mln cubic feet per day. The North Bakken Expansion project is also included in the capital forecast. As designed, this project in the heart of the Bakken will increase capacity by an estimated 350 mln cubic feet per day and is expected to be in service in late 2021. This business is exploring additional organic growth projects that, if executed, would be incremental to the capital investment plan. Natural gas production continues at record levels in the Bakken, driving the need for additional infrastructure.At the company's construction materials and services businesses, the capital expenditures forecast is focused primarily on organic expansion opportunities, normal equipment and plant replacements and upgrades. The Russell 2000 (-0.3%) closed in negative territory.The day began with the market digesting a tweet from a China-based CNBC reporter, who said she was informed by a Chinese government source that Beijing is pessimistic about a trade deal because President Trump hasn't supported a tariff rollback. Based on the modest losses and ensuing price action, the market presumably remained optimistic about a Phase One agreement.The large-cap indices eased their way into positive territory thanks to the turnarounds in the S&P 500 consumer discretionary (+0.3%), information technology (+0.3%), and communication services (+0.3%) sectors. Consistent leaders included the consumer staples (+0.5%) and real estate (+0.5%) sectors, as the negative-sounding trade headline likely fostered some conservative-minded interest.The trade-sensitive industrials (-0.3%) and materials (-0.2%) sectors were among today's laggards, but their losses were small compared to the 1.3% drop in the energy sector, which was pressured by the decline in oil prices ($57.04, -0.71, -1.2%).Generally, there wasn't any concerted effort to sell a market trading at all-time highs, but investors weren't eager to embrace risk, either. The trend has been positive, which has likely drawn in some reluctant investors into the market, and today simply may have been a natural breather for a market breaking out to new highs.Notable corporate news included HP Inc. (HPQ 20.01, -0.17, -0.8%) turning down the takeover bid from Xerox (XRX 39.30, +0.36, +0.9%). HP remained open to a deal, though. Netflix (NFLX 302.57, +7.54, +2.6%) shares outperformed on speculation that either Carl Icahn or Bill Ackman built a large stake in the company.U.S. Treasuries extended last week's advance, pushing yields slightly lower across the curve. The 2-yr yield declined two basis points to 1.59%, and the 10-yr yield declined three basis points to 1.81%. The U.S. Dollar Index declined 0.2% to 97.80.Separately, the NAHB Housing Market Index for November declined to 70 from 71 in October. Investors will receive Housing Starts and Building Permits for October on Tuesday.Nasdaq Composite +28.9% YTDS&P 500 +24.5% YTDDow Jones Industrial Average +20.2% YTDRussell 2000 +18.1% YTD16:21T AT&T: Sony (SNE) subsidiary Sony Pictures Entertainment acquires AT&T's minority stake in Game Show Network (39.63 +0.13)Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) and AT&T announced that SPE has acquired AT&T's minority stake in Game Show Network. Briefing.com: Hourly In Play (R) - 13:00 ETBriefing.comNovember 19, 2019 Tuesday 1:05 PM ESTCopyright 2019 Briefing.com, Inc. All rights reserved.This content is provided to LexisNexis by Comtex News Network, Inc.Length: 15193 wordsBodyHourly In Play (R)Updated: 19-Nov-19 13:00 ET12:57WRAPX Midday Market Summary: Stock market trades mixed; Home Depot, Kohl's weigh on retail spaceThe S&P 500 is currently down 0.1% in midday action, with weakness concentrated in the retail space following disappointing quarterly results and guidance from Home Depot (HD 226.39, -12.46, -5.2%) and Kohl's (KSS 47.58, -10.82, -18.5%).The Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.4%, but the Nasdaq Composite (+0.2%) and Russell 2000 (+0.4%) trade higher.The underperformance of the SPDR S&P Retail ETF (XRT 44.12, -0.71, -1.6%) best displays the negative sentiment that has subsumed the retail industry today. Both the Dow and S&P 500 consumer discretionary sector (-0.8%), meanwhile, can attribute their underperformance to Home Depot.The S&P 500 energy sector (-1.1%) is down even more amid a sharp decline in oil prices ($55.69, -1.45, -2.5%), but the market isn't getting concerned about the U.S. consumer based on a couple of reports. Instead, the market is hanging in there amid gains in the heavily-weighted health care (+0.3%), information technology (+0.1%), and financials (+0.1%) sectors.The consensus among many investors is that the market is due for a pullback, but the absence of one has created a sort of pain trade for investors fearful of missing out on further gains. The S&P 500 was down just 0.3% at its low earlier today before a buy-the-dip effort briefly brought it back above its flat line.Separately, shares of AT&T (T 37.65, -1.99) are down 5.0% after the stock was downgraded to Sell from Neutral at MoffettNathanson with a price target of $30. Shares of Slack (WORK 20.88, -2.24, -9.7%) have dropped 10% on news that Microsoft's (MSFT 150.99, +0.65, +0.4%) competitive product, Teams, has increased daily active users by nearly 50% since July.In the Treasury market, demand for longer-dated bonds has caused some minor curve-flattening activity. The 2-yr yield is unchanged at 1.59%, and the 10-yr yield is down two basis points to 1.79%. The U.S. Dollar Index is flat at 97.79.Today's economic calendar was limited to Housing Starts and Building Permits for October:Total housing starts increased 3.8% m/m to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 1.314 million (Briefing.com consensus 1.300 million) while total building permits increased 5.0% m/m to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 1.461 million (Briefing.com consensus 1.365 million).There was a sizable jump in starts (+8.6%) and permits (+8.2%) for multi-unit dwellings, yet the key takeaway from the report is that starts (+2.0%) and permits (+3.2%) increased for single-family units in an inventory-constrained environment for single-family homes.12:45MRK Merck increases quarterly dividend to $0.61 from $0.55/share (84.21 +0.08)12:25SCANX Small cap notable movers of interest -- Myovant Sciences (MYOV) gains on Phase 3 relugolix data -Technical-The following are some of today's most notable small cap movers of interest ($300 mln - $2 bln market cap), ranked by % change (all stocks over 100K average daily volume).Small Cap GainersMYOV (10.86 +79.21%): Announced results from the Phase 3 HERO study of once-daily, oral relugolix in men with advanced prostate cancer; the trial met its primary efficacy endpoint and all six key secondary endpoints -- in the primary endpoint responder analysis, 96.7% of men receiving the relugolix regimen achieved sustained testosterone suppression to castrate levels through 48 weeks. Wells Fargo noted that embrace of a public auction "does not seem to offer much potential capital to the satellite players" and also noted the impact that the public approach will have on timing, saying, "Getting this spectrum auctioned off in 1H 2020 (as the C-Band Alliance plan had outlined) seems naively optimistic at this point." CEO Mollenkopf just appeared on CNBC.11:35GMAB Genmab granted marketing authorization from the European Commission for DARZALEX (daratumumab) in combination with lenalidomide and dexamethasone as treatment for adult patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma who are ineligible for autologous stem cell transplant (22.61 -0.09)DARZALEX was approved in Europe in combination with lenalidomide and dexamethasone as treatment for adult patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma who are ineligible for autologous stem cell transplant.Approval follows positive opinion by European Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) in October.Approval is based on data from Phase III MAIA study.11:29AGN Allergan announces publication of results from ACHIEVE II (UBR-MD-02) (185.09 +0.89)Positive results from ACHIEVE II (UBR-MD-02), a pivotal Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of ubrogepant, have been published in the November 19 issue of The Journal of the American Medical Association. The ACHIEVE II trial evaluated ubrogepant 50 mg and 25 mg, compared with placebo, across a wide range of clinical endpoints, including the co-primary endpoints of pain freedom (no pain) and freedom from the most bothersome migraine-associated symptom at two hours post-initial dose. For the two co-primary endpoints, ubrogepant 50 mg and 25 mg showed statistically significant higher response rates for pain freedom at two hours (21.8% for 50 mg, 20.7% for 25 mg and 14.3% for placebo), and the 50 mg dose demonstrated statistically significant higher response rates for the freedom from the most bothersome migraine-associated symptom at two hours (38.9% for 50 mg and 27.4% for placebo). Additionally, ubrogepant 50 mg was statistically superior to placebo in the absence of light sensitivity (43.8% for 50 mg and 35.5% for placebo) and sound sensitivity (54.1% for 50 mg and 46.3% for placebo).FDA action on the NDA for ubrogepant is expected in December 2019, potentially making it the first oral CGRP to address unmet patient needs in acute treatment of migraine and the first FDA-approved gepant.11:21XLE Sector Briefing: Energy (58.71 -0.65)The energy sector (-1.1%) sits at the bottom of today's sector standings after showing relative weakness yesterday. That corner is the retail industry, which has been broadsided today by disappointing earnings/sales results and guidance from Home Depot (HD 226.60, -12.25, -5.1%) and Kohl's (KSS 48.09, -10.31, -17.7%).The weakness in HD is having an outsized impact on the price-weighted Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&P 500 consumer discretionary sector (-0.9%); meanwhile, the combined impact of the disappointments from these well-known retailers is creating some angst about consumer spending activity entering the all-important holiday selling season.That angst is showing up in a sympathy trade that has knocked down the prices of many other retail stocks today, like Macy's (M 15.36, -1.51, -9.0%), Best Buy (BBY 75.61, -1.68, -2.2%), and Gap (GPS 16.62, -0.68, -3.9%) to name a few. The SPDR S&P Retail ETF (XRT 43.97, -0.85, -1.9%) reflects the broader trend of underperformance for the retailers in today's market action.Those issues notwithstanding, the broader market is still holding up just fine as it is drawing influential support from the information technology (+0.3%), healthcare (+0.3%), and financial (+0.2%) sectors, which continue to attract interest from value and growth-minded investors alike.Separately, the market's overall resilience to selling pressure remains a tying factor for a number of participants who are fearful of missing out on further gains. That fear, ostensibly, is lending some buying support that has kept downside pressure in check.The Russell 2000 is up 0.2%; the Nasdaq Composite is up 0.1%; the S&P 500 is down 0.1%; and the Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.2%.10:00XLY Sector Briefing: Consumer Discretionary (120.74 -1.05)The consumer discretionary sector (-0.8%) represents an early pocket of relative weakness in a flat market. The studies were conducted in mouse models of melanoma and of colon carcinoma, each of which was modified to partially deplete regulatory T cells; GPR174 deficiency in these mice resulted in significantly reduced tumor growth and improved survival of the animals (p=0.006 in melanoma; p=0.03 in colon cancer) versus normal mice.XBiotech (XBIT) today announced rapid enrollment in its Phase 2 clinical study evaluating bermekimab in patients with moderate to severe Hidradenitis Suppurativa. The study is will enroll approximately 150 patients. XBiotech announced the first patient enrolled in the study on October 23. Today, XBiotech is already updating status of the study, reporting that 51 patients have now been randomized, or assigned to an investigational arm of the study.Advanced Micro (AMD) announced the AMD Radeon Pro W5700, a 7nm professional PC workstation graphics card. It delivers new levels of performance and advanced features that enable 3D designers, architects, and engineers to visualize, review, and interact with their designs in real time, accelerating decision-making processes and product development cycles. Cree (CREE) and STMicroelectronics (STM) announced today the expansion and extension of an existing multi-year, long-term silicon carbide wafer supply agreement to more than $500 mln. The extended agreement is a doubling in value of the original agreement for the supply of Cree's advanced 150mm silicon carbide bare and epitaxial wafers to STMicroelectronics over the next several years.ConocoPhillips (COP) is hosting an Analyst & Investor Meeting today to reaffirm its commitment to the "disciplined, returns-focused" strategy it launched in 2016. The company will outline the details of a 2020-2029 operating and financial plan and will provide region and asset reviews of its global portfolio. Highlights of the 10-year plan include free cash flow of approximately $50 bln, a forecast for underlying compound annual production growth averaging over 3%, and a projection for $30 bln in share buybacks over the 10-year period.09:16ALV Autoliv provides mid-term and long-term targets at Investor Day (82.22 )Medium term (up to 3-5 years) targets: On average to grow sales organically* by 3-4% more per year than light vehicle production growth and the company aim to improve its adjusted operating margin* to around 12%, based on an assumed average light vehicle production growth of 1-2% per year.Long term (beyond 5 years) ambitions: Our ambition remains to grow at least in line with our market. Since its launch last year, the Lab has helped construction organizations explore and test solutions from Oracle and the larger construction ecosystem in a simulated worksite environment. Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, will utilize Personalis' newest cancer immunogenomics platform, ImmunoID NeXT, for clinical biomarker identification and development.Revolve Group (RVLV) has launched its first portfolio brand on FORWARD by Elyse Walker. Equifax (EFX) extended its long-standing relationship with the National Consumer Telecom and Utilities Exchange, an independent, Fair Credit Reporting Act-compliant consumer reporting agency that maintains an industry-specific database of payment information for telecommunications, wireless, cable, pay TV, home security, and utility companies.08:06DAVA Endava beats by 0.06, beats on revs; guides Q2 EPS in-line, revs below consensus; lowers FY20 revs outlook, increases EPS guidance (44.01 )Reports Q1 (Sep) earnings of 0.24 per share, excluding non-recurring items, 0.06 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of 0.18; revenues rose 24.0% year/year to 82.35 mln vs the 79.65 mln S&P Capital IQ Consensus.
